website_summaries.verdict: This heavy-duty containment mat safeguards your floor from leaks, dirt, and any other grime that could drip from your car.
pros: The mat boasts improved durability and containment with commercial-grade polyester scrim and closed-cell foam edges
It uses stay-put corners to keep the product from lifting under use, and the included squeegee head makes cleaning simple
Rated for temperatures as low as -40°F
cons: The foam edges can cause the mat to bunch up, which can look messy and potentially cause tripping hazards

customer_reviews.title: Great Mat - Spend the Money!
customer_reviews.text: Auto Floor Guard is the first garage mat I came across and after lots of research the mat I purchased. I have two, the mats have performed excellent keeping all water from my garage floor. Cleanup is easy by either shop vac or squeegee. After a few weeks of use the mats have flattened better than I anticipated they would. I have two mid-size SUV's and the 16' length is ample. If you have the room I would get an 18' mat for assurance that all snow/water is caught.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: looks bad
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this. The terrible look of the mat and difficulty required to empty outweighs any utility of the mat. The mat bunches up and not only looks messy, but trying to squeegee water off requires others to pull the mat flat and hold the corners. Some area stick up so much its a tripping hazard. I could maybe see if the mat was cheaper... but its thumbs down at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Mic

customer_reviews.title: Works well but you have to manage the water or it overflows.
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the slop of the floor and on the FloorGuard. We live in Colorado and we have to empty the water about every day or it overflows onto the floor. So don't expect to drive on and off all winter long. You have to manage the water and slop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stay Put System Poor Quality/Design
customer_reviews.text: The ‘stay put’ system to keep this product in place is garbage - followed instructions, alcohol swabbed the back of the mat, as well as the concrete floor as stated in the instructions and in less than 24 hours the Velcro squares on the back of the mat were no longer sticking. *Update* it’s been about a month and the mat looks horrible - wrinkles haven’t relaxed and I’d say have gotten worse. Sarcastically, can’t wait to try to clean this wrinkled mess after some winter accumulation. Probably end up pushing it out to the end of the driveway on trash day.
customer_reviews.author: luvbooks

customer_reviews.title: Creases suck
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how this mat received so many positive reviews. This mat came folded instead of rolled. Now they are permanent creases that won’t come out and make it impossible to squeegee. What’s worse is even the edges are creased, and therefore water escapes through the lowered creases. Squeegee is also low quality, broke on them first attempt. Have to use my shop vac and floor squeegee instead. This mat is going back and definitely would not pay this hefty price.
customer_reviews.author: Planter

customer_reviews.title: the mat does not lay flat, the edges are a potential tripper
customer_reviews.text: I am not very happy with this product, the valcro corner self adhesive pads do not stay attached to the mat. The distributor has advised that I use Gorilla Tape to tape down the corners. They do not feel that this is a manufacturers defect. The distributor has expressed that they have 2 different products related to the dates they were manufactured in China. One is better than the other, I got the less quality mat. I purchase the mat in August of 2019 but did not install it until December, the mat has a 360 day warranty, that in my opinion does not mean a thing. BEWARE OF ETHICS OF THE DISTRIBUTOR!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Have only had this a couple months and no really big storms yet. But what we have had, this has held up. I will recommend putting the edges down, my husband did not do this. (it came with peices to do so.) It does shift a little but nothing terrible. Occasionally I'll have to straighten it a little before I park in the garage. But it's not difficult, I'm fairly petite and have no problems. This is the second brand/style I have owned for garage floors. The first lasted me about 4 years. Hopefully this one lasts as long or longer.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea of the quality of this mat by the picture. The manufacturer sent an upgraded mat because they have had a huge increase in business, which is an excellent thing! You can even unpack this and roll it out in a below freezing garage - no problem. I love this mat! It is keeping all of the snow, ice and muddy stuff off the garage floor, which makes for a good walk into the house. Keeps the elements contained so I don't have pools under the shelving units. Such a good product!
customer_reviews.author: kms

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: We bought a brand new home 3 years ago and wish we would have bought this before our first winter (if we had, our garage floor would have been protected and we wouldn't have the mud/sleet stains that we have now). It's fantastic. We had a ton of Idaho snow and rain this winter, so lots of snow/water carried into the garage off of our car and all we have to do is pull it on to the driveway to empty and clean. It's thick but not heavy (similar to a thick pool liner), it has the raised border, so puddles of water do not drain off the sides. Great product that is well-made and should last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought one for one side of garage last Fall and now this one
customer_reviews.text: It does the job of keeping the snow and mud of the garage floor. We have a very nice garage floor. The mat is ugly and you have to be careful not to trip on it. It is not easy to clean. It seems to stay put . This is our second winter with the first one and so far it has held up. The mats are better than a dirty garage floor!
customer_reviews.author: Lizz

customer_reviews.title: One month and so far Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: After a garage of water and ice with snow on the car melting, and after talking with a friend who has one of these, I broke down and spent the money. I love this thing so far. It does everything I want it to. It's wintertime here so I haven't taped it down to the floor yet. I would suggest maybe a large throwrug or a large piece of cardboard to lay at the driver's side door area....I plan to step down on that ...just in case there's water/ice on the vinyl. So far, so good, I like this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves this.
customer_reviews.text: Got this because my husband was looking for a way to keep the snow and water under control in the garage. We have studded tired and was afraid it would leave holes in it but got one of the mats that are fibers and put it on top of this. With the two working as a system it is great. This at the bottom keeps any heavy moisture contained with the bumpers that surround the mat and the top mat keeps this from getting damaged from the studs in the tires.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Wrinkles will go away in time!!
customer_reviews.text: Works just like it should. I’ve seen a lot of negative reviews for this product about not being able to get the wrinkles out and all I can say is YES there are wrinkles but that’s due to shipping the product seeing how it has to be folded many times just to ship. If you order this Matt in Winter and you don’t have a heated garage your gonna have to accept the wrinkles till it warms up then lay it out for several hours in the Sun and BOOM Wrinkles will go away. If your trying to protect your garage floor from Winters awful messes then this Matt will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Vetteman

customer_reviews.title: A must for garage floors in snow country!
customer_reviews.text: The epoxy covered garage floor was super slippery from melting snow before I set this up. It also contains the wetness to stay on the pad. Good quality! If you have studded tires I would recommend some kind of rubber mats. Our rubber mats moved a little during the winter months a little from turning the wheel inside the garage, but this floor guard didn't show any wear or tear. Also, if you have epoxy floors get some cheep runner carpet from big box store and place on the sides of the floor guard for better footing. In the spring I washed and rolled it up for storage. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Crusher

customer_reviews.title: Pros and Cons
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this floor mat to replace one that was at the house when we purchased it. Pros: this mat arrived in an easy-to-handle box and was not difficult to roll out. It is of a nice weight material and definitely does protect your garage floor from melting snow or rain coming off of a parked vehicle. Cons: the mat tends to spike up at the sides and make walking beside it in a cramped space difficult. It does not lay flat against the garage floor - the wrinkles so not seem to be getting better. I'm still debating about whether or not to request a return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: See the pictures and notice the amount of water on the mat and how dry the floor is
customer_reviews.text: Does what it needs to do, contain tons of water from melting snow. I was so tired of the lakes that built up in the garage which never drained the correct way and during the NE winters the slush and salt the mess.
customer_reviews.author: Brownie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. This has helped keep my garage clean and dry. Came with it's own squege to help keep it clean and dry. Only draw back was the sticky tape that came with it to keep it in place. It does not really work well, but it still stays in it's place where you want it to. All in all we are very satisfied. Thinking of purchasing another one for other side of our garage :)
customer_reviews.author: JAX

customer_reviews.title: Sticky Pads need re-designing
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact it’s keeping my garage floor clean and dry and not deteriorating the cement from winter salt and sand. It’s easy to put down and move if need be. My one negative is the sticky pads do not adhere as well as advertised. The car coming in and out has moved the mat forward even with the pads. I did clean the floor and mat with the alcohol pads as per instructions but within a few days they did not stay on the mat. But overall it’s not a big issue, it doesn’t move that much and can be moved back into place easily.
customer_reviews.author: pencil thin

customer_reviews.title: best , just the best
customer_reviews.text: i use the autofloor guard for my wife`s suv and it does the job perfectly cause the previous owner didn`t put a drain in the garage , the mat is not made of cheap stuff ( thick tarp ) , and i thought i`d have to buy a squeegee but there was one in the box as a bonus that i didn`t know of , wow! the only down is that the adhesive that is for the 4 corners to hold the mat in place is not very effective unless you live in warm weather , overall this is a great product !!!! i recommend to anyone i know...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and Quick Solution to a Complex and Potentially Expensive Problem
customer_reviews.text: We have had a drainage issue with our garage since it was built and these have made a huge difference this winter in the overall cleanliness of the garage. The snow, rain and pine needles stay in the confines of the mat allowing the majority of the mess to be cleaned up in a matter of minutes. To get the best results, you want to put them down while you still have good sunlight to allow the PVC to relax and lay flat. I waited too long this season and had to carefully use my heat gun which worked good but took a long time and didn't work anywhere near as well as the sun.
customer_reviews.author: Charles J. Sarchet

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this car mat.
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived quickly and it was packed well. It is perfect for my Subaru Outback. I am very glad I didn't get the longer one. It has quite a smell for its water proof coating, but that is the only down side. It contained all the dirty water from melting snow and it cleaned up easily with a hose.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ekren

customer_reviews.title: Keep your garage floors clean
customer_reviews.text: I liked the sizes available. I found just the right one for my vehicle and garage space. I especially like the fact that the edges are raised so that the melting snow will be contained and not spread to the other things I keep in my garage. I haven't had it long enough to know how easily it cleans, but the smooth surface looks like it will be easy. I didn't realize that corners that will adhere to the floor and the mat came with it. It should keep the mat in place and make it easier to stay smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Buxton

customer_reviews.title: Great solution to a wet garage
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. My wife always pulls her car into the garage covered in snow which then melts and soaks the drywall. The mat keeps all the water contained which I then can suck up with a shopvac or push out with a squeegee. I also do not secure it to the floor so I have pulled the mat out and flipped it over to get all the water and grime off which is much easier then using the shopvac. Great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Mac555

customer_reviews.title: Best design I've seen for a nasty job
customer_reviews.text: This is the best design for a nasty job. The edges are all sealed around probably some sort of foam. This provides that water will not run off the surface but be contained. It is light weight so you can easily just pull whole thing out for cleaning. My previous containment mat had like 30 pieces of plastic you folded over the edges to form a ridge and contain the water. After a couple years the plastic pieces deform and they are impossible to get back down. This all self contained unit is the way to go without a doubt. Seems to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: Mavis Shanks

customer_reviews.title: worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a few months ago just before winter started. and they are amazing. after driving in the salt and the snow it melts off onto the mat instead of my garage floor and then I just squeegee it right out. so easy. also husband car has a slight oil leak and it goes right onto the mat and not the garage floor I love it! only down side is you need to pull straight in onto mats not turn your wheels at all because it could possible mess up mat over time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible mat. Won’t refund?
customer_reviews.text: Terrible sexy mat!! Just missed the return window!!! So infuriating! We didn’t get the stuff out of the garage in time to look at this mat. DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY!! Slips all over, shiny and ugly worst product I’ve bought from Amazon in a long tine. If they would refund me I works to have bothered to post review but if I’m stuck with it then I at least need to warn others.
customer_reviews.author: Suzi Q

customer_reviews.title: Dry garage!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this in the premium size but I had to exchange it for the standard size because I have a very very small garage. The return process was easy and went smoothly, and both were shipped fast. I have an older '05 Jeep Liberty, live in snow country and this catches everything that falls off in the garage. My floor is dry now and I'm glad to keep the salt off. You do have to empty the water off it. I pull it out of the garage a couple of feet and just use a stiff broom to move the water to the end and then over the edge. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Molly A

customer_reviews.title: Garage stays dry!
customer_reviews.text: My husband thought I was crazy for buying this but is now very pleased. In wet, icky snow conditions, this mat held several gallons of melted ice, which we were able to vaccuum up with the shop vac. It is light enough to move outside to hose off. It is on its second winter with no signs of wear. It requires no assembly. Awesome product and my friend wants one too. I drive a Rav4 and bought the 16 foot model.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  Works well...for us.
customer_reviews.text: This works great. No more puddles in the garage and rushing to get everything off the floor. For us, we drag the tarp out on our slopping driveway to drain it. (It can also help melt snow in other parts of the yard, when the sun heats it up.) I wish it came in a shorter size. I might have to cut off one end, in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Lorrence S. Mahaffy

customer_reviews.title: Great mat. Easy to roll out and lays flat.
customer_reviews.text: I liked this mat for my VW Bug. It was easy to roll out and laid flat on the floor. I bought one for my wife's car from a different brand and does not lay flat making it hard to clean. I will be getting rid of that one and replacing it with this brand. I also like it heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Rubble

customer_reviews.title: Good strong material
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this getting ready for our first snow. Easy to install. Only surprise is my car just fits on the mat with only a few inches on each side. And I have a Prius. Will have to wait and see how effective it is in catching all the snow, rain drop off from my car and tires.
customer_reviews.author: edna

customer_reviews.title: Protects my attached garage
customer_reviews.text: Captures the melting snow and ice from my vehicle and is long enough to park my snowblower on, too, until the snow has melted. Saves the melted water from spreading to the outside walls and rest of the garage. I was so happy with the first one, this is my second one for my 2-car garage.
customer_reviews.author: AshKum

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: We live in northern MN and I bought it to protect our garage floor (and the belongings on the floor) from melted snow and dirt. So far the mat has kept all the water and dirt confined so I just have to shovel or squeegee it out. It fits perfectly in my small garage and is just the right size for my Subaru Outback. I wish I had this mat years ago!!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki T.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome catcher of snow and road dirt.
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing how much stuff comes off a car--especially in an Alaskan winter. This floor guard catches all of it. It is made with heavy duty material and is easy to clean. I didn't anchor it to the floor--which means it creeps a little bit across the floor. But it is easily adjusted back into place and, since it's not anchored, it's easy to fold it in half and clean the underside once a year or so.
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Works great and keeps my epoxy floor clean
customer_reviews.text: This is a great containment mat. Originally, I ordered the 18' by 7', and it was a bit small for my X5. I contacted the manufacturer and they exchanged for the 20' by 8', and it has been working great. Easy company to deal with and appreciate their fair exchange. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: S. Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Holding snow
customer_reviews.text: It is holding snow melt. The velcro for corners did not hold long. I can park a 4runner or our buick regal on it just fine. Just not as advertised and yet it is doing the intended purpose of holding snow. With lip all around makes pushing water off without getting it off to the sides difficult. Moved from velcro and is no longer next to garage door.
customer_reviews.author: TMR

customer_reviews.title: Failed
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this product I kept the melted snow from speading all over my garage. The problem is the seams broke in two different places and the foam tubing inside that acts as the sidewalls came out and continued to as we used it over the winter. So it only lasted 3 months. That's not good.
customer_reviews.author: JASON

customer_reviews.title: A leaker for sure.
customer_reviews.text: This thing leaked on the third day of use. Still trying to patch it. The squeegee pole did not telescope, only 2 feet or so long. This is a great idea, the quality is awful however..
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Order one size larger than the vehicle you plan parking on it.
customer_reviews.text: Main purpose for purchase was to park ice/snow covered vehicle in a heated garage and catch the melted water and debris not having a drain to clear. To date is performing to my satisfaction with ample capacity to catch the ice/snow liquid debris. Need a wet/dry vacuum to clear the contents without having the ability to drag out of the garage. Have picked up to 10 gallons of liquid (which was contained on the mat) with one vacuuming. Without securing to the floor it will creep driving a vehicle onto it. Took a little time for the assumed foam edges to "unpack" enabling liquid containment.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Deutschmann

customer_reviews.title: Good fit for my two cars
customer_reviews.text: Good fit for my two cars. Honda Accord/Chevy Malibu. Tired if using floor squeegee to get rid of snow/ice from floor. Bought it during winter time so it was unable to really stretch out. After I bought it I immediately laid it out and put some sand bags and heavy items on it to get it to lay flat as best I could. There are some spots where it still sticks up but overall it laid down pretty well and does exactly what I was hoping it would do. Overall, I am happy with this product very durable and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: No more cardboard boxes!
customer_reviews.text: For anyone with a garage floor that settled improperly, causing rain water or melted snow to flow in the direction of the wall (not the garage door), this floor guard is exactly what you need. I simply cut a 16 foot guard in half and now both bays have water protection under the front half of the car, extending 8 feet towards the rear of the vehicle. Any run off from the rear of the vehicle flows outward underneath the garage door (where it’s supposed to!). Problem solved! Looking forward to seeing how it handles snow this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I wish I knew about this product years ago. The fit was perfect. Super easy to move and clean. It comes with four sticky pads for each corner. I found I didn't need them as it hasn't moved at all. Best purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Cammie Hill

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this mat. It does contain water. Just wish it was wider as it gives me only a couple inches to spare and is hard to park on. I also end up making a big mess when trying to clean off the water. Not sure if I'll use it again next winter.
customer_reviews.author: Amy S

customer_reviews.title: Keep your garage floor dry!
customer_reviews.text: What a boon this has proved to be, for the third winter. Unroll it into position on the garage floor, and you're ready for snow and slush and rain dripping off your vehicle: the unit contains the mess, and keeps the floor dry. When the water is getting deep, use a squeegee to drain it out the door. No damage to anything in the garage now, no muss, no fuss. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: All About Taste

customer_reviews.title: but glad I didn't because it was more expensive and I'm ...
customer_reviews.text: This mat was very disappointing to me. I drive a Chevy Tahoe and it was just too small even though I measured my vehicle's wheelbase prior to ordering. Should have ordered the largest one, but glad I didn't because it was more expensive and I'm not impressed with the ridges on the edges to keep the water in. They are too low and flimsy and when I laid it out in the sun to relax, it still didn't relax flat and the ridges aren't sturdy enough to keep the water from melting snow contained.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Hiatt

customer_reviews.title: Its moves and full wrinkles
customer_reviews.text: If your hit your brakes or move to quick it moves with you then you have straighten it out, the peel and stick corners don't hold or stick to the floor or the mate, I was told it took take over a year before lies flat, buy in the summer and lay it out in the sun, and hope it lays out
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied owner
customer_reviews.text: It's the perfect width for my garage door opening and so far this winter it's done a great job containing the salt and snow. I would recommend this for anyone that is having issues with water and salt in their garage.
customer_reviews.author: Russell J. Pavlak

customer_reviews.title: ... sides so when ice melts it would contain it better in a garage that has some slight slope
customer_reviews.text: Wish it had a higher sides so when ice melts it would contain it better in a garage that has some slight slope. Installed for about a month and still have shipping folds even after cleaning it with hot water. Would recommend they ship it rolled vs. folded. Definitely beats trying to keep the garage cleaned during the winter. Buying a second one for second stall.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron V.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product, BUT to short!! Best for YUGO owners!! Snow falls off bumper, hits edge and lands on floor!! What's the purpose?
customer_reviews.text: it works BUT it's about 6 inches to short!!!! My 2018 Mitsubishi Outlander just makes it. Unfortunately, when the snow falls off the bumpers, it hits the edges of the floor guard and spills onto the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert De Jesus

customer_reviews.title: Does not lay flat works so so.
customer_reviews.text: The mat moves around, puckers up and will not lie flat. The stay put velcro corners do not stick to the mat despite using rubbing alcohol prep cleaning. All in all I should have bought a tarp and 1x2s at the hardware store and built a similar mat.
customer_reviews.author: JimLinda

customer_reviews.title: Great item, must have.
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who live in a rainy, snowy area, needs one of these. I was always flooding the garage at night from all the snow melting off my truck, this is amazing. We remove it in the summer time, it folds up and stores away easily.
customer_reviews.author: Cowgirlongreen

customer_reviews.title: This product has been fantastic!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one Auto Floor Guard to try it out and it worked so well I purchased another soon after for my second vehicle. It does exactly what I was looking to accomplish-to keep the snow, ice, and water contained under the vehicle. The padded edges hold everything on the floor guard. I find it very easy to keep clean. The floor guard does come with a small squeegee to use to clean the mat but I use a driveway sealer squeegee, much bigger, stronger and easier to get the job done. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Sanborn

customer_reviews.title: When it gets dirty from the salt
customer_reviews.text: My husband is very particular about his garage floor, so he purchased this due to my insistence that I park in the garage during the winter. This is the second winter we have used it and have had no issues. It holds the water from rain and snow run off, really well. When it gets dirty from the salt, etc., he pulls it out on the drive and rinse it off. When we aren't using it, it folds up and stores easily! Would definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent product..
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good product. Side and front "noodles/Edges could be twice as high. With the pitch of our garage pad we get a bit of overflow in the one front corner. I placed 2x4's under the front edge and half of the one side to eliminate the overflow on snowy/rainy days. Hopefully it will hold up for several years. Very pleased with the product overall
customer_reviews.author: steve Nemeth

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a clean and dry garage floor in the Winter.
customer_reviews.text: Having been frustrated every winter with snow, ice, mud, and water accumulating on the garage floor, I found the AutoFloor Guard. Now, it accumulates on the Guard, which I can simply slide out of the garage and fold it over to get rid of the mess; then, pull it back into place on the garage floor. After Winter I’ll pull it out and spray it down with a hose. My garage floor remains clean and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory L

customer_reviews.title: Great Big Mat for 2019 Silverado - Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: Everything I had hoped it would be and more. Fits my 2019 Silverado perfectly. Easy to unbox and laid out very nicely. Seems very thick and well made. I needed a wide mat and the 8'6" was just the ticket for my truck. Add the $20 coupon from Amazon and this is deal you really can't pass up. I'd buy again.
customer_reviews.author: MWB

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for our garage! It keeps the salt and sand off of our mat flooring in the garage during the winter. It is perfect for what we needed and stays in place when the car drives over it.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren D.

customer_reviews.title: Best garage floor containment mat availalble!
customer_reviews.text: This one is the best! I have purchased Car Pad and Clean Park brands of these garage mats several times. The Auto Floor Guard premium is better than any other the others. 1. no assembly 2. heavier duty 3. better quality. Yes this one costs more, but it is the BEST value.
customer_reviews.author: 911pcarguy

customer_reviews.title: Go buy a different squeegee
customer_reviews.text: The squeegee is terrible who want to get down on there hands and knees with a 2’ sponge.I don’t know if the handle was supposed to be longer but mine broke when putting it together. so I guess I will go buy a different handle and use it that way. The garage mat is great was surprised at how well it was made works great for my atv with a lot of snow on it no more wet floors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: The auto floor guard turned out to be exactly what I expected. It will work fine when the weather turns bad. It is supplied with four adhesive pads for the corners but I would suggest not using them until you know exactly where the corners will end up. On the negative side, the lip around the perimeter can be a trip hazard. This is a necessary evil that you will have to roll with. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Relations
customer_reviews.text: A friend had purchased one of these last winter and I was so impressed that I purchased one as well. After a short time there was a defect in the seams around the edges and the piping started to come out. I called the manufacturer and within one day they had shipped me another floor mat. I was very impressed with their Customer Relations Dept. and would recommend this product especially if you live where it snows.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Wells

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: Not a cheap fix but it does work and holds the water fine. The only real complaint is adhesive pads don't work but works fine without them.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Great invention, keeps my floors dry!
customer_reviews.text: We have a plywood garage floor that also slopes towards our mud room. When water drips or melts off the car it typically pools inside our wall or in our mud room. This may collects all the water, is light and easy to drain and perfect for our needs
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Works as described but no way to empty the water easily.
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Captures all snow and ice melt from the car and the lips on the edges prevent the water from spilling onto the floor. The only problem now how to empty the water from the mat!
customer_reviews.author: Ken K.

customer_reviews.title: Great way to keep your garage floor dry in winter!
customer_reviews.text: We do not have a drain in our garage and we were putting down cardboard for years to soak up the snow. The cardboard would get destroyed and would need replaced quite often. This new floor guard is doing great catching the snow that falls off my car. The sides are raised so it stays in the mat. A broom for pushing the water out was also included. So far huge hit and well worth the $$.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mats always wrinkled
customer_reviews.text: Bought two mats one for each car. Mats came wrinkled when unwrapped and have stayed that way. can not get wrinkles out have tried to do when cleaning using their squeegee. but straighten out and then back to wrinkled with air pockets underneath of mat. plus high ridges allow tripping over and makes it hard to get water out aftr cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: RICK

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had pictures to post of this, but know it works fantastic! We used to have to use a fan to dry the floor in the high bay where we park our truck when it had snow chunks that would fall off. Now, this mat contains ALL the water.
customer_reviews.author: killrnails

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I'm in Minnesota where a lot of road salt, ice, snow gets dragged into the garage. The Floor Guard has kept it all contained and I no longer have to be constantly cleaning the garage floor. I just squeegee the floor mat off and occasionally flip it over outside on the driveway. Works great. Was delivered neatly packaged with clear instruction on how to install and maintain. Pretty sure I'll be getting a 2nd one for the other vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Homer S

customer_reviews.title: easy to park the car on it
customer_reviews.text: Our garage has a room underneath it. In our northern Minnesota winter environment our car would accumulate snow in its wheel wells and under-frame. This would then melt in the garage and leak through the garage floor into the room below. This mat did the trick! It captures all of the snowmelt and we simply sweep it out the garage door. I left a few inches of the mat protruding out the garage door to make sweeping easier. Our car is a Subaru Outback and to make things easier I purchased the largest mat...easy to park the car on it.
customer_reviews.author: David W Litsenberger

customer_reviews.title: Wider not longer is important
customer_reviews.text: The size we bought is extremely narrow. Very. To go to next size would be 20ft long. Otherwise grt concept to solve our problem. Abt 6-8 inches wider would have done it ~
customer_reviews.author: M. Wolveck

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome, easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: Use this for my Tacoma works awesome!! Holds all the water, slush, and mud that accumulate on my truck. Easy to clean off with a broom or hose off or use the included blade, however I find if there are rocks on the floor guard it’s easiest to broom off
customer_reviews.author: Eze

customer_reviews.title: The Floor is Dry
customer_reviews.text: Waited for warm weather so I could put it in sun so creases would ease. Still not completely flat, but it is catching water and keeping it off garage floor. When we get some HOT days, I'll pull it into the sun again and hope that it will lose more of the rises and falls. Happy with the thickness and appearance and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: kiteo

customer_reviews.title: seams
customer_reviews.text: unfortunately all the folded over seams have pulled apart (detached) causing the foam boarder to come out
customer_reviews.author: Tom Colucci

customer_reviews.title: Garage mat to catch winter drippings!
customer_reviews.text: This product is sturdy and a TS as advertised. Our first snowstorm produced a lot of snow thawing from the car in the garage. The mat contained all the water which I squeegees our the door with the included squeegee the next day. Highly recommend this garage mat.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! I've had the one you have to piece together and boy is this easy!!! lay out and your done!!! I have my Camry parked on it and it fits great!
customer_reviews.author: jubbie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, so glad I got this. Keeps the snow, rain, and crud on the mat, keeping my garage floor clean. Easy to clean too
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great, Best Brand Yet!
customer_reviews.text: BEST brand ever! This is my 3rd type of garage car mat and this has been the best by far! I highly recommend this one, easy to clean and catches everything! Keeps my garage nice! It has held up great. You can vacuum this and also spray it off with a hose. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS ONE!
customer_reviews.author: RobertSC

customer_reviews.title: It keeps the water off the floor and I'm happy!
customer_reviews.text: This has saved my garage floor. The wrinkles haven't really settled much but that isn't a factor for me. It keeps the water off the floor and I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: RGordon

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as advertised. Holds a surprising amount of water. Wrinkles significantly (several inches high) as a car is parked on it, but the wrinkles actually result in small "pools" of accumulated water water which are easily removed with a wet vac. After significant snow melt from our full-sized SUV, it takes about 15 minutes (and five vacuum canisters full of water) to clear completely.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: bought for Ford Escape. perfect size, holds lots of melted snow and dirt and keeps my Epoxy painted garage floor looking great.
customer_reviews.author: stoneygreek

customer_reviews.title: Full Size Car Mess...Contained!
customer_reviews.text: It works very well when I remove clumped snow from bottom of my car first, otherwise it can't hold all the snow in Michigan. Spring clean up was easy. I removed it from the garage, hosed off all the road grit and salt residue, applied a little car wash and used a brush with long handle to gently scrub clean, then rinsed and dried. I will leave it down year round. I am satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to our garage. Saves our concrete floor from the snow, slush and salt of the harsh western N.Y. winters.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Great mat to contain snow melt in heated garages.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this mat after having snow repeatedly melt all over our heated garage for the past two or three years after driving on a snowy day. It was so nice not to have to worry about stepping in a gigantic puddle in the garage or otherwise ruining anything on the garage floor. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: L. Arroyo

customer_reviews.title: does not lie flat, difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: While this product is lightweight and its rolled outer edges do keep ice/water/dirt off the garage floor, it is very difficult to clean off and empty due to the fact that the material in th main part of the floor guard is always creased and does not lie flat
customer_reviews.author: Katherine E

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first winter. So far no issues, works well, keep water off the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for messy cleanups in garage.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. Water would go everywhere in my garage. Now I don’t have to worry about water ruining any of my cabinets etc,
customer_reviews.author: Lori Casinghino

customer_reviews.title: I have it in my garage and I'm happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I have it in my garage and I'm happy with it. Every fluid I spill can be easily whipped away. The only drawback is, the material is not super tough. You have to be careful not to scratch it. I bought super cheap fiberglass trays to protect it from the jack stands. This works nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Der_Chris

customer_reviews.title: No more melted snow in your garage!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two for the cars we drive all the time in the snow. Now we just pull in the garage and thats it. No more cleaning up the garage floor. When it gets full, just drag it into the driveway and sweep it clean. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Big Bad Rob

customer_reviews.title: Pouring off water
customer_reviews.text: Harder to pour off the water then o expected. Otherwise we’re happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mats work great and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: These mats work well to contain snow and dirt. The best feature is their ease of installation compared to other solutions. Plus they are easy to clean after use.
customer_reviews.author: Frank C.

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: It works great I got the biggest size for my pickup, I live in North Dakota, with heavy snow it will keep water on it for about a week. Thinking about getting a smaller one for my car, the stickiness of adhesive to keep mat on concrete floor only works for about a week, but it stays in place pretty good without it.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works really well at keeping water contained even when there is heavy snow. The only downsides are the price, that it does slide around easily and it is slippery when wet which can make it hard to get in and out of the car. Still worth it for me to avoid water damage issue to walls that I had last year.
customer_reviews.author: bells30

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t had it too long, easy to install and seems pretty good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Justin J

customer_reviews.title: I use this for my house in Colorado. Our ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my house in Colorado. Our car is always covered in snow. Keeps the garage perfectly clean. Ive had several friends purchase since seeing mine!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Having troubles with getting to lay flat even after being out in the sun. But it seems to be functional and certainly helps to keep garage dry.
customer_reviews.author: Ann SMA'74

customer_reviews.title: Knock-off
customer_reviews.text: What I received was not the Auto Floor Guard mat. I have one already and its great but this second one is some type of knock-off. Nowhere on the mat does it say Auto Floor Guard and the "guards" are flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Parv

customer_reviews.title: Compact works for a 2009 Honda Fit with plenty of ...
customer_reviews.text: Compact works for a 2009 Honda Fit with plenty of extra room. I installed it in the winter, so it didn't lay 100% flat without wrinkles, but I am sure I can get it flat by heating it up in the spring sun. I put some heavy rubber mats in each corner to keep it from curling up.
customer_reviews.author: Eric D Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Built strong and easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. It does slide, however it is easy to move back into place. I have purchased two of these. I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Who's Your Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Just put in a new floor in the garage and this was a must for this winter, so far it has been flawless and doing a great job with containing the slush from the car. Word of warning, it will move if you brake to hard when you park.
customer_reviews.author: Icyharp

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product that performs as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Very solid mat. The material used is top quality and very thick. Walls are tall enough to keep Snow/Salt/Sand contained and from getting all over your garage floor. Purchased recently during cold weather and unable to fully get mat to lay flat due to thickness of material. That said, it still performs very well though next year I will place in direct sun light during a hot day before placing for winter.
customer_reviews.author: Nick-A

product_meta.title: NEW Heavy Duty AutoFloorGuard Midsize/Small SUV Containment Mat 7'9"x18'
product_meta.description: Size:7'9"x18'AutoFloorGuard has been the #1 market leader in garage containment mats for over 5 years. Yet this year, we have evolved our design and engineered the best performing containment mat ever! After a year of extensive testing, we have made subtle changes to our product design including the following. We improved the methodology for forming the containment edge that has proven in tests to outperform previous methods of design in a variety of tough conditions. Secondly, we optimized fabric weight for durability, flexibility and reducing wrinkles. Finally, we developed new way of package preparation for AutoFloorGuard that better allows the product to lay flat right out of the box (reducing wrinkles) and improved the performance of the containment edge. Our Optimized Commercial grade fabric is polyester scrim material that is treated with a coating process that allows for PVC to coat and intertwine with polyester strands, making it stronger than ever. PVC fabric is used and trusted in the trucking industry to handle the road’s toughest conditions day-in and day-out. Our fabric is also mildew and rot resistant, along with being ultraviolet treated to resist fading and prevent fabric breakdown. Heat-sealed watertight seams are reinforced and thermal welded for durability and functionality. Finally, we made the product totally ready to use as soon as you receive it. This year we have included a Free Squeegee & Telescoping pole and our exclusive AutoFloorGuard design Stay-Put Corners in the box.
feature_bullets: NEW/UPDATED– Upgraded to optimized fabric, plus Stay-Put Corners and FREE squeegee & telescoping pole. Everything you need is in the box!
PROTECT YOUR GARAGE FLOOR– Built-in (enhanced) containment edge keeps all of the snow, ice and mud off of your garage floor.

ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY, NO ASSEMBLY REQUIRED, AND EASY TO CLEAN– Heat-sealed watertight seams are reinforced and thermal welded for durability and functionality. Simply just unfold the mat and it’s ready to use.
STAY-PUT CORNERS INCLUDED – Copied by some but invented by the original AutoFloorGuard, the leader in keeping your garage floor clean!

1-YEAR WARRANTY – All AutoFloorGuard containment mats include a 1-year warranty and have not changed the key features that made AutoFloorGuard #1 in the containment mat industry for over 5 years. See warranty for details.

specifications.Special Features: Free Stay-Put-Corners included, Free Squeegee Head included, NEW and improved Heavy Duty Material
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars610 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
